## ICobuildLockProvider interface

> This API is provided as a beta preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 


**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface ICobuildLockProvider 
```

## Methods

<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[acquireLockAsync(context)](./rush-lib.icobuildlockprovider.acquirelockasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** The callback function to acquire a lock with a lock key and specific contexts.

NOTE: This lock implementation must be a ReentrantLock. It says the lock might be acquired multiple times, since tasks in the same cluster can be run in the same VM.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[connectAsync()](./rush-lib.icobuildlockprovider.connectasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** The callback function invoked to connect to the lock provider. For example, initializing the connection to the redis server.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[disconnectAsync()](./rush-lib.icobuildlockprovider.disconnectasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** The callback function invoked to disconnect the lock provider.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getCompletedStateAsync(context)](./rush-lib.icobuildlockprovider.getcompletedstateasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** The callback function to get completed state.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[renewLockAsync(context)](./rush-lib.icobuildlockprovider.renewlockasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** The callback function to renew a lock with a lock key and specific contexts.

NOTE: If the lock key expired


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[setCompletedStateAsync(context, state)](./rush-lib.icobuildlockprovider.setcompletedstateasync.md)


</td><td>

**_(BETA)_** The callback function to set completed state.


</td></tr>
